article.title: Nature of Pre-Earthquake Phenomena and their Effects on Living Organisms
article.abstract: Earthquakes are invariably preceded by a period when stresses increase deep in the Earth. Animals appear to be able to sense impending seismic events.

sections.introduction: Earthquakes are caused by the build-up of tectonic stresses.

article.insights_summary: Animals appear to be able to sense impending seismic events. Positive airborne ions can cause unusual reactions among animals.
article.acknowledgments: This work was supported by NASA grants to Friedemann Freund from the NASA Earth Surface and Interior (ESI) Program (NNX12AL71G through the San Jose State University Research Foundation) and from the NASA Exobiology Program (NNX10AR81G through the SETI Institute).
